WorkItem.ClosedComment: This issue has reached 60 days without response. If this is still an issue, please resubmit with reference to the currently affected versions and any necessary files.
WorkItem.Description: The "new version released" dialogue always causes a crash in mono, so that it is impossible to use an older version on a Mac.  The error dialogue also crashes so I haven't been able to get a copy of the error message; however, the issue has occurred in all previous versions of Rawr that I'm aware of.  Would it be possible to simply disable the new version notification manually?
WorkItem.Summary: [Base] New version released! dialogue causes crash in mono

Comments.Message: Never heard of that dialog causing a crash before, but yes, you can disable it. There's a 'check for updates' option in the Options dialog. If you can't get to that, you can also find it in the .config file.
